meanings.definition: The state or condition of being a spectator.
meanings.sent1: Her spectatorship at the game was enjoyable.
meanings.sent2: The theater was full of spectatorship during the play.
meanings.sent3: His spectatorship of the movie made him forget about his worries.
meanings.sent4: The spectatorship of the crowd was like a sea of faces.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the ballet left a lasting impression on her spectatorship.

meanings.definition: The act of observing or watching an event or performance.
meanings.sent1: The children's spectatorship of the magician was filled with wonder.
meanings.sent2: The concert hall was buzzing with spectatorship during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The cat's spectatorship of the birds outside was comical.
meanings.sent4: The spectatorship of the stars in the night sky was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The intense spectatorship of the race made the atmosphere electric.
